criteria: Application of Vocabulary in Different Contexts
descriptions: Demonstrates minimal understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Struggles to use new words correctly.
Demonstrates limited understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Uses new words incorrectly or inappropriately.
Demonstrates basic understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Uses some new words correctly, but struggles with others.
Demonstrates satisfactory understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Generally uses new words correctly, but may make occasional errors.
Demonstrates strong understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Uses new words correctly and effectively in most contexts.
Demonstrates excellent understanding of academic and domain-specific vocabulary. Uses new words correctly, effectively, and creatively across a variety of contexts.
Uses words inaccurately and inappropriately, hindering comprehension.
Uses words inaccurately in several instances, affecting comprehension.
Uses words with some inaccuracies, occasionally affecting comprehension.
Generally uses words accurately, with only minor errors that do not impede comprehension.
Uses words accurately and appropriately in most cases, enhancing clarity.
Uses words with precision and nuance, enhancing clarity and sophistication of expression.
Shows no initiative in independently gathering vocabulary knowledge.
Rarely attempts to independently gather vocabulary knowledge, even when prompted.
Occasionally attempts to independently gather vocabulary knowledge, but relies heavily on direct instruction.
Independently gathers vocabulary knowledge with some success, but may need occasional guidance.
Actively and independently gathers vocabulary knowledge, demonstrating resourcefulness and effective strategies.
Demonstrates exceptional independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge, employing a variety of strategies and resources to expand understanding.
Unable to apply newly acquired vocabulary in reading, writing, speaking, or listening.
Struggles to apply newly acquired vocabulary consistently across different contexts.
Applies newly acquired vocabulary in some contexts, but struggles with others.
Generally applies newly acquired vocabulary effectively in reading, writing, speaking, and listening.
Applies newly acquired vocabulary skillfully and appropriately across a variety of contexts.
Seamlessly integrates newly acquired vocabulary into reading, writing, speaking, and listening, enhancing communication and comprehension.
